On Sun, Nov 18, 2012 at 2:52 PM, Stephen Connolly <
stephen.alan.connolly@g=
mail.com> wrote:

> No it doesn't.
>
> Explain how comparing objects based =
on the results of the objects public
> getters being the same breaks encaps=
ulation?
>

This:

  return getFirstName().equals(other.getFirstName()) &&
=
      getLastName().equals(other.getLastName());

leaks a lot more implemen=
tation details than

  return this.equals(other);

It also won't get you ve=
ry far if the identity of the object is an
implementation detail that's not=
 exposed with a public getter.

-- 
C=E9dric
